title._content: [Portrait of Ben Webster, Eddie (Emmanuel) Barefield, Buck Clayton, and Benny Morton, Famous Door, New York, N.Y., ca. Oct. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Ben Webster, Eddie (Emmanuel) Barefield, Buck Clayton, and Benny Morton, Famous Door, New York, N.Y., ca. Oct. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Both small bands recently featured at the Famous Door on Swing Lane attracted attention and gave patrons continuous kicks. Above Ben Webster mugs with Eddie Barefield, sax; Buck Clayton, trumpet and Benny Morton, trombone. Not shown are Cliff Leeman, drums, and Billy Taylor, bass. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 390 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "Sharp little groups brighten Famous Door in NYC," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 21 (Oct. 8, 1947), p. 2. Subjects: Webster, Ben Barefield, Eddie (Emmanuel) Clayton, Buck, 1911- Morton, Benny Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Fifty-second Street (New York, N.Y.)--1940-1950. Famous Door Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.03671 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 0367
